summary: An email from an unidentified sender ('P c') to a team, likely prosecutors, congratulating them on securing an indictment in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The email praises the team for overcoming challenges like old facts, statute of limitations, and working with victim witnesses to build a strong case.

persons.name: P c
persons.role: Email sender, likely a supervisor or official
persons.context: The author of the congratulatory email to the prosecution team, commending their work on the Maxwell indictment.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: Referenced as the subject of the indictment the team successfully secured; the case is described as 'worthy' and 'should have been brought.'

connections.description: P c is congratulating a team for securing an indictment against Maxwell, indicating P c is in a supervisory or supportive role relative to the prosecution.

events.title: Celebration Email for Indictment
events.description: An email is sent to a prosecution team celebrating their successful work in securing an indictment in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

keyFacts: A prosecution team successfully secured an indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell, as of June 28, 2020.
The case faced significant challenges including old facts and statute of limitations issues, which the team overcame.
The team is praised for securing cooperation and trust from victim witnesses with empathy and dedication.
The email sender ('P c') views the case against Maxwell as indisputably worthy and one that should have been brought.
